casebody.data:
GLOVER
v.
The CHARLOTTE-MECKLENBURG HOSPITAL AUTHORITY, et al. 356P18-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. May 9, 2019 R. Kent Brown, Attorney at Law, Jon Ryan Moore, Attorney at Law, Paige L. Pahlke, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, John R. Taylor, Attorney at Law, Robert E. Zaytoun, Attorney at Law, Matthew D. Ballew, Attorney at Law, Raleigh, for Glover, Briana Washington, et al. John H. Beyer, Attorney at Law, Katherine H. Graham, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for The Charlotte-Mecklenburg Hospital Authority, et al. Daniel N. Mullins, Attorney at Law, Durham. William Conor Brockett, Associate General Counsel. Phillip T. Jackson, Attorney at Law, Asheville, for N.C. Association of Defense Attorneys.

The following order has been entered on the conditional motion filed on the 22nd of October 2018 by North Carolina Association of Defense Attorneys for leave to file Amicus Curiae Brief:

"Motion Dismissed as moot by order of the Court in conference, this the 9th of May 2019."

Ervin and Davis, J. recused
